description: Buy the Gregory 30L Raincover online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 30L Raincover
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory 30L Raincover online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The rain cover fits my 24L Gregory daypack great. It looks great and it feels high quality, sturdy. When the rain started it was easy to put on in a flash and kept everything dry. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great Rain cover

review.reviewBody: Haven't had to use it in the rain yet thankully, but it fits my pack perfectly (unlike every other I tried). I have a Jade 28 (2023).
review.name: Fits Great

review.reviewBody: Fits great and as advertised!  No issues with it going over the MIKO20
review.name: Great Cover!

review.reviewBody: It fit my 30L Gregory pack perfectly, and the leaves print was a nice change from ordinary rain covers.
review.name: Good fit and good cover.

review.reviewBody: This is a well-made raincover. It held up nicely in puring rain and dried quickly afterwards. The built-in storage pouch is attached to the raincover, so it is impossible to lose. The 30L raincover fit over my Osprey Nebula (34L) backpack. The tropical pattern is very unique and appealing.
review.name: Great design and universal fit
comment: Thanks for the feedback.  Feel free to switch over to to the Border Traveler 30 when you are ready to make an upgrade on your pack.

name: 30L Raincover

description: Buy the Mammut Glacier Dry Cord - 6mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Glacier Dry Cord - 6mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Glacier Dry Cord - 6mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Extremely lightweight and well-made. Hoping I never actually have to use it for a crevasse rescue.
review.name: Rescue gear

review.reviewBody: Ultralight rap cord for rapid couloir assaults. Absorbs virtually no water & handles really well...no tangles unlike other 6mm ropes I've used. The thought of carrying a full diameter rope for ski touring is unthinkable after using these. Some specialized rappel techniques are required to use them safely but nothing that can't easily be learned. Highly recommend these ropes!
review.name: Perfect Couloir Rope

review.reviewBody: Perfect weight to strength option for roped glacier travel
review.name: Great go to for wet glacier roped travel

review.reviewBody: I bought 2x 30m of the glacier cord. It's extremely lightweight and packable - you barely notice it at the bottom of your backpack. The sheath is durable and very supple which makes knot-tying a breeze. The only caveat is that the glacier cord doesn't have any middle marker which can be fixed by drawing one with a permanent marker. Otherwise, it's a nearly perfect product.
review.name: Lightweight, durable, easy to use glacier rope

review.reviewBody: Fills the light recovery role well that other manufacturers don't have covered.
review.name: Specific use. Light. Very static.

review.reviewBody: Takes the weight of a full sized rope off your to make the day out a bit easier. Make sure you practise the specific techniques this rope requires as it is much thinner then most ropes.
review.name: Light and Small

review.reviewBody:
This is the ultimate rope for lightweight glacier travel and ski/splitboard mountaineering. I prefer to use two separate 30m lines over a full 60m since it's much more versatile. 
The sheath in this rope compared to other brands makes it much more durable and for a rope with a shorter lifespan this is indispensable. 

Worth ever penny, but it would be great to see this with a 40m option as well.
review.name: Ultimate lightweight rope kit!

review.reviewBody: Overkill for a tag line when using a single role and needing to do a double rope rappel. For that I would look at the BD, Edelerid, or other options like that in the more affordable world. This cord excels when you are going to be encountering the alpine environment. Great competitor to the Petzl RAD line and given the specialized scope of the Petzl Pro program, this is a great alternative!
review.name: Great cord for use around snow.

review.reviewBody: Use it for a tagline on multi-pitches. Love it, light and easy
review.name: Rad

review.reviewBody: I rated it a 5 stars because it's just what I need for a ski patrol self rescue rope.  I recommended 9-10 because I haven't put it to use yet.

name: Glacier Dry Cord - 6mm

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These feel so good on my feet. Even though they’re substantial and padded they fit close to my foot and I don’t feel like I’m walking around with blocks on my feet, which happens so often with shoes like this. Also not too heavy. Feet stayed warm and dry in a bad rainstorm. I love these.
review.name: Maybe the perfect shoes.

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fit is tight, good weight, going to try some long walks soon
review.name: More for walking than trekking

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these, they stick to trails and are even good in snow, excellent all around and so comfortable, they are warmer than my snowboots
review.name: Love them

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wore these on a recent hiking adventure and the shoelaces gave out.  Nice shoe but what good does it do if quality of shoelaces fails.
review.name: Good But ...

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Pros: Look sharp, no blisters or chaffing. Stretchy upper is cushy to wear.

Cons: Stiff sole is hard on sensitive feet. Stretchy upper allows a lot of foot motion, sliding around. I found these shoes fairly hot to wear.

name: Mountain Trainer Lite GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use the Mosquito harness for sports and alpine climbing. I really appreciate the light weight and the freedom of movement this harness is providing me. in the same time it is super comfortable and I feel well protected.
review.name: Super light and really comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought it a year ago and just keep going for this harness over other ones with more features. I’ve sport climbed, and multi pitches with it. No issues. Only love.

review.reviewBody: Bought this as I wanted a light weight harness for sport climbing. Its really good and i can barely notice it when im climbing and allows me to have a full range of motion. Its also really good price for a light weight harness as all the others a so expense and do the same things. definitely will be buying again. review.name: really comfy and light weight.

review.reviewBody: I've been climbing in the regular Origin's for a long time and love the fit. I was excited to try the new Origin VS with it being toted as a gym shoe. I purchased the same size as my Origins, and the fit is slightly different. Since the original Origin features a leather upper, it's probably shaped to my foot over time so trying the VS out of the box it makes sense that the fit would feel more snug. That said, they still fit great and the single strap makes taking them on and off a breeze. What I am MOST happy with though, is the rubber! It is SO sticky and the sensitivity higher than the original making it excellent for the gym and finding the micro features on the holds. They breathe well enough that I can keep them on for an hour without feeling uncomfortable. And they look super cool! For sizing, I wear a street size of 11.5 but wear a 10.3 (43.5 euro) in Scarpa. Toes are slightly curled but not uncomfortable when standing on flat ground.
review.name: Go To Gym Shoe

name: Origin VS Climbing Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for an extra stiff flat shoe to aid in climbing and this shoe seems to work well. Not only pretty stiff but sticks to the pedals very well. I dont think there is a stiffer flat shoe out there, and I am happy with the Freerider Pros all around goodness.

Fit is also where it should be. If you are in between sizes, I would size up a half size to be safe.
review.name: Good looking shoe with great grip and a stiff sole

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very solid flat shoe. Warm in the winter acceptable in the summer.  Engages with the pedals super well.   These are my third pair in 8 years.
review.name: Great flat pedal shoe

review.reviewBody: They are good looking shoes. Son picked these shoes out
review.name: This is a Christmas gift. But my son picked these

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome firm cycling shoes. Used them for a century ride. Comfortable and excellent grip for my pedals.
review.name: Gave up clipping in with these shoes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this shoe EXCEPT that the tongue always goes towards the outside of the shoe. Big toe box is a plus as is the rigidity of what's beneath my foot - helps on bigger drops. If it helps, I'm on the big side at like 6-6 and 245-250 riding weight. Comes in larger sizes is another plus.
review.name: My go to shoe for flats

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The laces color combination i din't like, it's a good shoe i wish you had a wider size by going to 11 size it makes the shoe to long.
review.name: wider size would make it perfect

review.reviewBody: I ordered a size 13 because that is what every shoe/boot I own is.  This 13 wasn’t even close so I returned them.  Back country charged me a return fee.  This shoes were returned in perfect condition.  I tested them for about 10 seconds on my carpeted living room floor.  It is not my fault that these shoes are  sized incorrectly …. I will not risk another purchase from Backcountry.
review.name: Terrible Customer Service.
comment: We understand your frustration with the sizing of the shoes and the return fee. We have sent you an email to discuss this further.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My last pair of 510’s were very durable and and gave me 9 years of wear
review.name: Great looking kicks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are sized small.  I've worn a size 15 for years.  These were way too small.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] comfort and stylec omfort and style comfort and style comfort and style

review.reviewBody: They're probably good for other stuff too. Really expensive puzzle cutters with sharpening and modification? I used these on my park bike over the summer and they really reduced fade. Better calipers could go further, but the rotors with sintered pads screamed like Sramshees when they got dusty and slowed the bike whenever needed. So I ordered this set for my all rounder. A big boi in it's own right, a Niner e9 WFO.  Compared the the centerlines that came with the bike these are much lower fade and noticably less free play as well. Thanks to the thicker rotors, the pads grab sooner and they've allowed me to go from two finger braking to one finger braking. In the name of consistency, they are now on all my mountain bikes.
review.name: Best thick bois for Sram Brakes

review.reviewBody:
I’ve used sram center line rotors for a couple years now and the performance was great but once they get overheated you end up with a couple issues.  Chatter and vibration.

I decided to try the HS2 and see how they hold up.  Performance is right there with centerline.  Brake feel and stopping power are exactly what I’m used to.  The big improvement is heat dissipation.  I have yet to overheat them and I’m taking longer runs without having to stop and let them cool down.  Very happy with the new design, way to go Sram!
review.name: Stands up to heat better than centerline

name: HS2 Rotor - Centerlock

review.reviewBody: I've sold so many Alphelia jackets that I had to try one myself after hearing such great feedback from customers. As soon as you put it on, it feels so soft and plush that you know it's a super nice jacket. I love how comfortable it is and how classy it looks. It does run on the smaller/more slim side, so if you are in between sizes or you want to layer additionally on the coldest days, size up. My favorite two features are the detachable hood and the plush mesh ventilation in the interior back of the jacket. This jacket is awesome and I definitely recommend it if you want to be warm, dry and look great at the resort or anywhere you go this winter.
review.name: Very Warm, Classy Ski Jacket

name: Alphelia Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I switched to these from SPD pedals/shoes, and while that switch was a no-brainer for a road bike, these pedals have been excellent to use this past summer. Installed easily and feel great. I'm building a new bike and making my current bike a Wahoo Kickr bike. I'll likely get another set of these so I can have them on both my current and new bike.
review.name: Couldn't ask for anything more

review.reviewBody:
They lost the plates and after that , they became flexibles . 
Life is around two years.
review.name: Durable is not one of the strengths

review.reviewBody:
I spent $160 in '86 at my LBS the week the Dura-Ace 7401 came out. I was so eager to ditch the "caged" pedal system I'd been using. (Aside: these pedals and their ilk are not "clipless"-clearly you want to be clipped in, but are "cageless" end of aside.)

Anyway while 7401s were great pedals and still would be fine to ride on, Shimano has made small refinements the past 35 years to where it's hard to see how much further they could take things to make a better pedal.

Almost perfect pedals. I put them on my bike, ride them and don't worry about them. I once had a bearing loosen on the 6800 predecessor model, but that was easy to remedy. 

One thing though, the 8000's CF body is more prone to marring in my view. I haven't crashed using these, but did fall off my bike last winter while dismounting on a near frozen WA mountain road. I was surprised by the chipping the pedal body endured from that. I think old style aluminum bodies would have handled this much better. If you are a new rider uncomfortable "clipping in" and prone to tipping over while doing so, I'd recommend getting a pair of used pedals to practice. Note to my son and others who have difficulty learning to clip into this style pedals: Don't forget you can pedal with one leg while trying to get engaged with the other leg! Also, when coming to a stop remember to disengage one shoe from the pedal also!

Shimano shaved off a little bit of stack height on these from the 6800 series which means the shoe of your shoe is closer to the pedal axle. I didn't really notice this much-at least not to the point where I lowered my saddle. 

However, more significantly I feel, these are the easiest pedals to clip into on your "first try". I've even been able do fo it on 8% grades on one lane roads where I pulled over to let a vehicle go by. I don't know if there's a bigger contact target for your cleat to engage or if the pedal moves more slowly before going "nose up" prior to engagement, but there is a marked improvement in ease of engagement in my view.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: For someone that comes from 105 shimano pedals, would recommend upgrading to the shimano ultegra R8000. Lighter pedals, slightly wider angles. This gives me more power to push on those climbing hills.
review.name: Great Pedals

name: Ultegra PD-R8000 Pedals

hasVariant.name: Hot Pack Easylight Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sportful Hot Pack Easylight Jacket - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: don't understand how this was designed.  I am an average proportioned 5" 6" 140 lb male.  This was extremely tight around the abdomen, so much that I had trouble breathing. It was so big in the shoulders that I could hear them flapping as I was riding.  My friend told me I looked like a cartoon action hero.  I returned it after using it twice, unfortunately for credit and not a refunn
review.name: Really poor fit

review.reviewBody: I'm 6ft even, weigh about 165-170, usually wear medium or sometimes large jerseys (depending on manufacturer). I ordered a size L and even before attempting to zip up the jacket, my arms already felt completely constricted (I'm no Schwarzenegger). Once zipped up I realized there was no way I could even breathe. This item is sized for 22 year-old Italian pros ?!??!!
review.name: Should've read the reviews (sizing)

review.reviewBody: I read the reviews and tried to size up enough to get one that would fit me.  I normally wear a medium top.  I ordered an XL and it was still way too small.
review.name: Nice super light jacket, but very small

review.reviewBody: I am 5'9" and 172lbs and I usually wear Large size on most brand tops, but after reading some reviews, I chose to go for the XL size. The XL fit was loose on the sleeves and chest and I was hoping for a better fit so I end up swapping the XL for a Large size instead. The Large  was incredibly small. I though i was going to rip the jacket as i was trying it. Something is wrong with their sizing. I end up returning it and looking for another jacket.  too bad, it seemed to be a good quality jacket.
review.name: Good quality but runs small

review.reviewBody: I read the reviews stating it was too small, so since I usually wear medium, I purchased an XL.  Still too small around the chest and shoulders, which is weird.
review.name: Hot Pack Easylight Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I'm 5' 10" 185 lb. and picked a Large based on the sizing charts and it was off by at least one size if not two. Large should be a small. I will try an XL.
review.name: Inaccurate sizing

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for my Dad for Christmas and was very disappointed in the sizing. He is usually a size large and I ordered him an x-large to be safe and it fit more like a small-medium. I wear a women?s medium and couldn?t even zip it up 

If you do buy, I would size up two to three sizes
review.name: Runs very small

review.reviewBody: My measurements fell into size S and it fits perfect.  It is a snug fit and that's the way I want it since it won't be flapping in the wind.  It kept me warm in the low 50's in the early morning start and a long descend off the mountain.  It also doesn't get too hot when temp reaching the 60's.   Perfect for So Cal cool weather.   It stuff nicely into the jersey pocket.  the only thing I wish it has is a two way zipper.
review.name: Good simple wind breaker jacket

review.reviewBody: I ordered a L, I could barely get it over my shoulders, and it was about 4 inches from closing. Too bad, because it seems good otherwise, but I'd say this is a Small at best.
review.name: Way too small!

name: Hot Pack Easylight Jacket - Men's

The calves and mid-thighs are super-tight, I don't think it's really made for muscles. review.reviewBody: Used this underquilt for my past two  camping trips and it works great! Used with a Eno single nest hammock the underquilt was warm and fit the hammock perfectly. I also tried it out with a double nested hammock and also fits great, underquilt covers the back side and comes up on the sides as well which is great for windy days. I paired this with a light fleece blanket and a 40* rated sleeping bag and was warm all night. Definitely recommend this for late spring/summer/early fall trips. Dipping below 40* might get a little cold, which makes sense since the quilt is rated 40*-60*.
review.name: Great Underquilt

review.reviewBody: Recently just added this to my hammock and made hammock camping such a dream! The added warmth underneath really kept me warm all night long and fit so easily over my Eagles Nest hammock.
review.name: Must have for hammock camping

review.reviewBody: I now have 4 different versions of Trail 2650, why would you buy 4 pair? I have prescription (aversive high Arch) orthotics and this about the only shoe that I can also retain the existing inner sole without feeling too tight on my upper foot. I do a lot of hiking and they have great support and good traction. When I find shoes that work well I buy 2 or more pairs pin different colors, they last longer and you never know when they change or dis-continue the model.
review.name: The Danner Trail 2650

review.reviewBody: I have a few pairs of these and wear them most days. I am on my feet a good portion of the day as a home inspector and these shoes perform well. Good durability, breathable and agile. These shoes run true to size or a bit small.
review.name: Great Everyday Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I wore this straight out of the box and hiked 50 miles in 3 days in the Grand Canyon. Amazingly comfortable and had zero issues with comfort and fit. I'm 200 lbs. and 5'11--purchased size 12. 
 
Giving 4 stars because, I can see that the toe rubber is already beginning to peel away off the shoe. I hope mine were an abnormally defective.

I recommend them and would buy another pair, but would be weary of the rubber pealing off the front toe. I do wish they had BOA laces.
review.name: Perfect Comfort Out of the Box

review.reviewBody: Great hiking shoes!!! My husband loves it! Fits true  to size.9
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: got these for a day hiking trip to the porcupine mountains in the UP of Michigan, didn't have time to break them in like I normally would with new shoes but these things were amazing. 20+ miles in 2 days zero problems, comfort straight out of the box.
review.name: comfort straight out of the box

name: Trail 2650 Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great coastal rain jacket for Southern California.  Well designed and well made.  I'm a size 6 and a S in Ariat tops. Ariat recommended a Small. It was a bit snug to comfortably fit a warmer layer underneath returned it for a M. Love the deep red color. I wear it out and about too. Haven't tested it in the rain yet but I expect it will meet my needs in this mild winter location.
review.name: Good design, quality workmanship

review.reviewBody: This jacket is just the right weight fo early fall in the PNW.  It is comfortable and flattering. The grey is a great color. The water beads up nicely when it rains.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody:
Ariat has really outdone themselves creating the perfect silhouette in this jacket!  It’s very well made with taped zippers.  The fabric is soft and drapes perfectly.  Seems to good to be true that it’s water resistant- but we’ll soon see! Plenty of well placed pockets.  I absolutely LOVE the 2 back side zip- bustle like- feature.  When wearing the jacket unzipped I keep the back zippers zipped down.  As soon as I zip it up, I unzip the bustles allowing more room (through the hips and butt) while keeping/creating an  hourglass silhouette.  It’s genius.  A must have to bring out the best in your shape while also looking effortless!  

 For reference I ordered XL.  5’8”, curvy (38DD). Typically XL jackets are too snug in the chest and xxl are just too big all over.  This fits perfectly over a med weight sweater.  

Backcountry had the best price and 1 day shipping -means 1 day!   I guess that’s why they’re the goat!
review.name: So flattering!!  Order it!

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit and true to size for me, I am 5ft 3inch and size 10 and S for Small was fine as I am not wearing anything bulky underneath.
review.name: Great Fit and Really Nice Coat

review.reviewBody: Extremely happy with this jacket.  I am a true petite.  5’ 95 lbs.  Fits well, the sleeves are a little long, but there is a Velcro closure that helps.  Zippers on each side for riding comfort.
review.name: I love this jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely LOVE this jacket. I’m 145lbs, athletic build and sized up from my normal medium to a large so I could layer sweaters underneath. Very flattering, washes well, truly waterproof.
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this jacket in green for the 2nd time and also decided this time to buy the navy. So flattering, water resistant and the perfect weight for riding. This is a staple in my riding wardrobe.
review.name: A riding staple

review.reviewBody: Beautifully designed. Very flattering. Great jacket for the equestrian.
review.name: Best Looking Jacket

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket the fit is so flattering and gives you plenty of room to move so very practical for riding. Really great quality fabric. I bought a small and am 5’4” and 130lbs. My new favorite jacket.
review.name: Quality and Style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket fits so well.  Just love the way I can create more room around my hips by opening the 2 zippers in the back.
review.name: Perfect Fit for XL Lady Size

name: Coastal Waterproof Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: 30in Snowshoes

review.reviewBody: First of all, in the description the only sizing guide provided goes by weight stating that this size is good for someone 200 pounds or more. Which would accommodate myself with gear. What it doesn't make clear is the size of the binding which were way too big for my feet. This could be my fault due to my lack of knowledge about sizing snowshoes. But I thought I should share that so no one else makes the same mistake. Another issues was the heel risers. They are not simple to use at all. It takes a lot of force to put them back down once you've put them up. You have to pull the sides apart in order to flip them down. Not great if you're hiking on the side of mountain and need to quickly switch from flat ground to steep climbing. The crampons are actually nice and sharp and I do like the binding system. If the issue with the risers was fixed, I might recommend them.
review.name: Not ideal for hiking

name: 30in Snowshoes

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, it's super comfortable.  I'm almost always a medium at 5'10" 160lbs, but after reading the reviews I sized down to a small and it fits perfectly in all aspects even with a base layer and midlayer on underneath.  Only con for me is that the chest pocket is a little small, it's a struggle to get my phone in and out.
review.name: Awesome Jacket - Just Size Down!

review.reviewBody: I have several Helly Hansen ski jackets all in size large, so I ordered this one in large as well.  The jacket came in today and it is huge, size X-Large.  I called to have it exchanged with Backcountry, but they refuse to exchange it for a size medium.  This is the last time I am using backcountry for any of my outdoor gear.
review.name: Beware Large is X-Large

review.reviewBody: Lots of nice features in the jacket, very solid construction, and plush soft shell material. Sizing a little bulky for me as someone with a slimmer runner's build. Overall, felt it was a bit too heavy for my everyday backcountry workhorse. Returned this and kept the Patagonia Stormstride Jacket, which checks in a full 9oz lighter without being flimsy. Also, didn't like the somewhat small side zip vents vs. full pit zips.
review.name: High quality softshell

review.reviewBody: I'm really amazed by the quality of this shell. It's burlier than I was expecting, and the green color looks sick too. I did go for the medium size after reading the reviews of people who usually wear large that got mediums. Good call, the medium fits perfect with layers.
review.name: Look no further!

review.reviewBody:
It's pretty decent jacket and I like it overall...  As a shell jacket, it protects me from wind and moisture pretty well as advertised.  
But like others indicated, the size and design of the size are a little odd.  I know I'm slim runners built (5'10'' and 140lbs) and wear S size from TNF summit series shell jacket, but this one feels much bigger especially around chest/shoulder area.  The good thing is I can wear even with thick fleece jacket when riding colder days.  Comparing with my go to shell jacket (TNF), it feels a little heavier too.  
It does not have the pocket for my pass like all other jackets have.  It does not have powder skirt inside either.  Maybe because it's for BC purposes, but I don't think it's hard to make them for convenience.
review.name: Nice jacket but...

name: Verglas BC Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: bought 25mm and when mounted measure 23.5mm. Not happy but what's my choice? I've used Conti for many years and never had this problem.
review.name: too narrow

review.reviewBody: I’ve been riding Continental tires for the last two decades. The GP5000s are almost impossible to mount across their range. The clinchers are quite challenging to mount, so much so that they don’t feel safe in the event of a roadside flat. Trying to mount new tires leaves me with multiple blisters. The tubeless version (not these) are also horrible. I will be another brand going further.
review.name: Almost impossible to mount

review.reviewBody: I have ridden on many iterations of Continental Grand Prix tires. I switch between 25c and 28c. The 25c accelerates slightly faster than the 28c, but once up to speed, the 28c won't slow you down. If you're looking for more confidence descending, choose the wider options, as there is more surface contact with the ground. The 28c offers a slightly cushier ride and can easily handle a few miles on fire roads. I ride hundreds of miles on the Grand Prix tires before changing them and experience few punctures. It would be hard for anyone to convince me to try another tire; no other tire can beat the Continental Grand Prix 5000.
review.name: Cornering Confidence and Silky Smooth

review.reviewBody: It’s a trainer tire…what can you say. Working well after a few months of 5 hours a week on the bike. No premature cracks or wear. Got another to have on hand when this one is done
review.name: Does the trick

review.reviewBody: Love these tires. Great traction and puncture resistance and good durability.
review.name: Great tire.

review.reviewBody:
I had a flat last week and when I repaired it I found three other lacerations in rear tire. Doesn't even have 50 miles on it.

Never seen anything like this in prior tires...

I am running them as training tires now.
review.name: They are grippy but puncture easily

review.reviewBody: I love these tires and Backcountry offered a terrific price.
review.name: Continental Grand Prix 5000 Clincher Tir

review.reviewBody: Yes I cheated on my Contis.  I'd been a Conti fan for years but got tired of the tight fit.  I moved to two different brands and both had failures so I'm back.  The trick to getting Conti's on and off is to use Park Tool TL-6.3 tire levers and wear gloves.  They are longer so you have more leverage and the gloves will give you more power without feeling like you're going to hurt your hands.  Its still not easy but definitely alot easier and doable as long as you follow general tire mounting procedures.  If you're on the road you're likely to already have gloves on anyway.  The GP4000's and now GP5000's are known for low rolling resistance and for me, they've been bulletproof on the road.  I also like the way they look.  I recently moved from the 25's to the 28's and believe they are a bit easier to mount.
review.name: I strayed and came back

review.reviewBody:
The pairs of 25's I ran for over 10 yrs did very well:  fast, ran at 90psi, not that comfortable, good durablity, when worn out did flat more, cuts did happen from glass, nails etc on the side of the road, but main problem was getting the last 6" over the rim, so very depressing when having a flat, especially trying to get under the tire bead to pry the tire off then having to use a tire bead jack getting it back on-  often resulting in pinching the new tube!!

Enter the 28.  It's just as fast, 50% more comfortable.   I'm 200lbs and run at 85psi. The 28 is 75% easier to get the tire on, 50% easier in getting the bead out to remove the tube, then again 75% easier getting the tire back on usually just by hand so eliminating the chances of pinching!!   I have had the same results on getting it on my Astral aluminum and Astral carbon rim.   I've had them over 2,000 miles and the first week got a pinch flat from something near the side of a city street, but no problems since on city or rural roads.
review.name: 28 IS WHAT YOU WANT!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Like a few other reviewers have mentioned, these tires have problems. I too had a sidewall blowout on a smooth road,  and I just put them on a few weeks ago. On the other tire I had a couple pinch flats since it was so difficult to mount. I won't be buying these again.
review.name: Sidewall blowout

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wonderful for our 4 year old! We love how you can fold up the gauntlet to get the mitten on then unfold it for the extra protection. Our daughter loves them so much.
review.name: Best mittens we’ve found

review.reviewBody: Much better than your typical toddler gloves. They are actually warm and have some decent insulation. My daughter has enough room underneath for extra set of gloves too
review.name: Great for my 2 year old

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful color and great fit. The size is great for your wrist
review.name: cozy mittens

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased these mittens for my two year old granddaughter.  They are easy to get on and off and they keep her hands warm.  I would recommend these mittens to all parents and grandparents.  The quality and fit are an A plus.   You will never go wrong with Columbia!
review.name: Warm and Toasty Hands

review.reviewBody: I thought these gloves would be alittle thicker. Good quality but I dont see them being very warm
review.name: On the thin side

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Unfortunately these will have to be for next season as they run a bit big for our toddler. Love how long they are, but these are definitely for older kids.
review.name: Run big for little hands!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the length of these gloves for little kids.  They kept my child’s hands warm, dry, and I didn’t have to worry about snow getting inside of them.  It allowed us to have fun playing in the snow, without the worry of cold or wet hands.
review.name: Great gloves for little kids

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Because the material was of good quality, I recommended it to a friend and bought it for her son too.
review.name: Long Mittens

review.reviewBody: The Zone is lightweight, very comfortable for all day, carries alot of gear, and durable. I'm enjoying mine so far. I've used several different harnesses and this one is my current favorite.
review.name: Best all around harness

review.reviewBody: A very tight fit for my wife. The legs loops don't get parallel with body causing the loops to cut into legs with pain and discomfort. Would return if I could.
review.name: Desgn flaws

review.reviewBody: Secure, comfy and easy tie in. Snug as a bug…lightweight…don’t even know it’s on.
review.name: Excellent harness

review.reviewBody: I love the weight and the material of the harness. I ordered the same size I wear in other Black Diamond harnesses. Unfortunately the leg loops aren’t adjustable and are tight on me so I’m concerned they’ll be uncomfortable. I don’t have particularly large legs and can’t recall adjusting previous harnesses so I didn’t think about it when ordering. Disappointing because it has a lot of other great qualities like the infinity loop.
review.name: Light weight, small leg loops

review.reviewBody: I belay and climb almost every day for my job and this harness is so comfy for belaying. The wider Leg loops fit very well. Very easy to adjust and also super light compared to most I've tried out.
review.name: Comfy Harness

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite harness by BD yet. Light yet super comfortable.
review.name: Light and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Beautiful design, nice colors, light in weight. Easy to use, practical to pack. It was time to make a change from my previous harness, this choice for me was excellent.
review.name: A beauty

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use in the gym and some smaller climbs in the Southern Utah area and it has been great so far! No tugging or pinching in awkward spots. It also works for men. My husband had to borrow it at one point and he had no complaints!
review.name: Great Harness!

name: Zone Harness - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. I wear hiking pants almost exclusively and these and fantastic. Ordered my normal size (32x34) and it's exactly the right fit. Really nice material (durable but also comfortable) and the zippers are also good quality. Will probably turn into my favorite pair of pants. Do recommend!
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody:
Ordered my size based the fit calculator on the Livsn website—recommended a 33x32. I'm typically a 32/33 depending on brand—5'11", 175lbs, fit. These pants were so tight that my jelly beans almost fused into single jelly bean. Length was great though and I really like the style and fabric feel.  

I'm guessing I will have to go two to three sizes up to find a fit.
review.name: Sizing is Wonky

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of the mustard color livsn flex canvas pants during the kickstarter. I purchased these pants (black) because I liked the original pair. The fit was completely different. Very tight with much more tapered legs. Not sure why the pattern would differ based on the color, but buyer beware!
review.name: Tighter than my other flex canvas

review.reviewBody: These check all the boxes: great fit, attention to detail, quality materials & rugged construction. I have a slim, athletic build and it's hard to find pants that fit well, but these are an exception. I was so pleased with the first pair I bought I ended up buying three more pair in different colors. Can't say enough about the quality of these pants. WORTH EVERY PENNY!!
review.name: My favorite pants

review.reviewBody: I like the pants. Great fit. Very comfy. The only downside is that the black pair picks up every dog hair (or piece of lint) within a mile radius. I constantly look like I slept on the floor. Whatever. It's a look. Oh, and the mini pocket within the pocket is coming loose. I hate that I sound so negative. They're great pants!
review.name: Also make an excellent lint roller!

review.reviewBody:
Great pants.  Probably my new favorite.  They have a great fit and the material is softer than I expected.  But they still seem very durable.   I don?t think I?ll use the pant roll-up feature, but it?s well thought out.  I really like the knife pocket.  Much better than sticking my knife in the same pocket as my car keys and phone.  I?m 6?-01? and the 32x32 is a perfect fit.  I just need to make sure they don?t go into the dryer.  

Overall, I?d say these pants live up to the hype.
review.name: They live up to the hype

review.reviewBody:
These pants have a can-do attitude.

Except 'can-fit' on anyone over 6 feet tall. Honestly...topping out at 34 inseam, and that in only one waist size? The rest are all 30s and 32s?
review.name: Can-Do attitude!

review.reviewBody: These pants are very high quality while being extremely comfortable.
review.name: My go to pants. Getcha Some!

review.reviewBody:
I have black, brown and caramel.  Since i've bought these the only pants I wear that AREN'T these are dress pants.  However, I've worn the black with a nice shirt and looked great!

Caramel is by far my most worn, favorite, color.  My daily driver.  After that the brown.  I've been meaning to pick up a pair of the olive as well.  They are just that comfortable!

I had a slight issue with discoloring and they sent me a new pair!  I had a button come off and they are repaired it.  A++ for Customer Service and Warranty repair

Honestly, these really are that great
review.name: My Every Day, Do Everything pant

review.reviewBody: These pants are awesome. I had backed their project originally and I will continue to buy them. Though, they?ve handled everything I?ve thrown at them I?m just going to own everything color of these pants because they aren?t going anywhere. It?s really great to see them on backcountry. Their colors haven?t faded at all for me. Still bright and vibrant. Their pocket placement and functionality are executed well.  I?d say you need to buy a size or two up from my experience.
review.name: My go to pants.

name: Flex Canvas Pant V2 - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I can?t say enough about these boots.  First off, made in Oregon, USA.  America makes great shoes!  These boots have supple Horween leather.  Make sure the length is correct, sides may be a bit tight at first, but the break-in is minimal.  I use Redwing Leather Cream and it only darkened the slightest bit.  Super color!

The fit forms to your foot to become super comfortable and almost feel like they are custom made.  The slightly thinner Vibram sole bends easily.  No telling how long the soles will last, but these are marketed as light hikers.  Trade offs in sole thickness is part of weight reduction.  With correct lacing they don?t slip on the foot and provide a solid base.

Just so much better than my old Merrels.  Definitely worth the money.
review.name: Dinner Mountain Pass Horween Leather

name: Mountain Pass GTX Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Been using Skratch labs now since 2021.. and sometimes forget how mild it is vs what else is on the market. During recent IRONMAN, I didn't have access to Skratch until I got to my personal needs bags so tried what was on the course - the acidity of the other product hit me hard and I stopped drinking it until I had access to my bag. I also packed this for the run. I have an uber sensitive stomach and Skratch is gentle... love it.
review.name: Best hydration on the market

review.reviewBody: Biking in the heat is a necessary evil here in Utah. Its either that or not bike at all. A bottle full of skratch comes with me on every ride and keeps my hydrated and ready to keep climbing, plus I don't feel like crap (as much) when I get back to the car. Makes the rest of my day go more smoothly.
review.name: Best flavor

review.reviewBody: It works. I cramp if I only drink water on long XC bike rides- never an issue with this mix. Tastes fine. Doesn?t make your mouth sticky like some sports drinks can.
review.name: Effective.

review.reviewBody: I am training for my first 70.3 and dealing with a lot of nausea as I ramp up hours. Scratch labs has a very mild taste and gentle on my stomach. Love it.
review.name: Amazing stuff for sensitive stomachs

review.reviewBody: Dr. Allen Lim is a training genius and the Skratch products are as good as it gets. Replace what you lose in sweat with exactly what you need to maintain proper sodium levels while training in any condition.
review.name: The Best!

name: Hydration Sport Drink Mix - 60-Serving Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Sunriser Run Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like the style and fit of this vest. I'm 5'6 smaller frame 32b chest and the small fits nicely. I love all of the pockets and areas for storage. The water bottles don't bounce or move around which I like but I give this only 3 stars because the water bottles leak. I wore this on a hike recently and my shirt was completely soaked.
review.name: Leaky water bottles

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for. Something in the middle of a light weight hydration pack to carrying nothing at all. This vest feels like you have nothing on but your shirt. Fits just enough for a nice insulated jacket along with snacks. I may have ordered a size too small, I like the best so much I don't want to return it. 5'6" 130lbs and the small is a little tight.
review.name: I will be buying a medium soon as I gift the small to my wif

review.reviewBody: Light, functional, great storage. Awesome for marathon prep in Las Vegas
review.name: Light and Fits well. Super Functional.

review.reviewBody: Used this for a 50k last weekend. Wow it was impressive! First of all, so many pockets to store fuel and my phone, water bottles. The construction is very reliable. I would even use this on a daypacking trip.
review.name: Reliable for distance!

review.reviewBody: First time buying a north face item online.i had to return as it was a too small for me.im a size small and I thought this would fit me but i was wrong.i needed a size Large or medium but they were out of stock
review.name: No thanks on this item

review.reviewBody: I love my vest! It fits perfect and holds a lot in the pockets comfortably even with both water flasks full no bouncing at all. There is a lot of room in the back also but I haven't had to use that part yet. The whistle works well too. Durable And washes well. I'm 5'3 145lbs and ordered a small and fit perfect.
review.name: I would buy this Product again!

review.reviewBody: I love this for trail running! Easy access to the water bladders, and enough compartments/zippers for plenty of storage - clothing, nutrition, etc
review.name: Great for all trail runners

review.reviewBody: Zero Bounce, Useful and Functional Minimalist Vest. 100% Recommended!
review.name: I would buy this vest again and again

review.reviewBody: On my first use it felt a bit awkward as I have never had something like this. After about the 5th mile it was comfortable. Holds plenty of liquid for hot afternoons. The only drawback is not being able to keep water cool.
review.name: Promising

review.reviewBody: After using this vest on a few training runs I have to say that it exceeded my expectations. The fit was just right and felt comfortable. The pockets are perfect for my phone, car keys, and a couple gels. The water bottles stay securely in place and it's easy to sip from them without removing them. I highly recommend this vest by "The North Face!"
review.name: Highly recommend this vest!

name: Sunriser Run Hydration Vest

review.reviewBody: I really liked this hoodie until I washed it - either the hoodie shrank, or my arms grew a couple inches longer.  either way - after one wash it is way too small
review.name: Looks great just dont wash it

review.reviewBody:
For some reason it is nearly impossible to find hoodies these days that are 100% natural fibers. I got these on sale and love them. They are soft and not too warm.

Other reviews mention the sizing being too small, I couldn't disagree more. I usually wear a medium and should have bought a medium in these, too, per the sizing chart. I followed the advice of another reviewer and got the size Large. It is definitely an oversized fit. Sleeves are too long and the body is baggy. I don't mind an oversized fit but it's not what I was going for. I am 5'10, 190lbs, and of average build. Just go by the size chart.
review.name: ideal hoodie

review.reviewBody: I literally am the epitome of a size Medium shirt. Literally every t-shirt, button down, hoodie or jacket I own is a medium. Even a couple medium shirts from Topo that fit perfectly, but this?! It’s small. Very small. It’s short and tight and a true disappointment. My recommendation, size up at least one size!
review.name: Great style and quality, awful fit

review.reviewBody:
Seems like Topo keeps cutting corners; I expected this to be a substantial, durable piece. Just trying it on, I could tell the fabric was so thin that it would wear out within a year. They make it look more substantial by doubling up the layers on the hoody, but the body is unimpressive.

Also, not sure why they have the armpits on this cut so low; if you raise your arms to any level above your stomach it lifts up the entire hoody, pretty odd choice when the marketing shows folks going out bouldering in these.

On the positive side, fabric is very soft and the colors are nice. Just wish this was of the same quality as the Dirt Shirt, but with the comfort of a sweater.
review.name: Nice Colors, Cheap Feel

review.reviewBody: This hoody is beautifully made but is very thin and not warm. For the price I would expect a more durable and technical piece that can be used in the city and on trail.
review.name: stylish but not warm

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Aspect 3 Tent : 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought 3 tents for my guests because I run a small trekking company in Peru, but we had a really bad experience with these products because our gear inside the tents got wet.
review.name: Not water proof at all

review.reviewBody: This is an amazingly light, super comfortable hiking tent.  It’s probably the best tent I’ve ever owned.
review.name: Amazing Hiking Tent!

review.reviewBody: I bought this exact model 4 years ago. I am a wildland fire fighter, so I need a lightweight but durable tent. I bought this tent knowing I'd be living in it for 14-21 days at a time. I used Camp Dry (blue bottle) and seam sealer on the rain fly, floor and footprint for added protection. This tent held up against all sorts of weather from 112 degree days in Arizona to 28 degree nights in Oregon, it served me well until it finally wore out. It is incredibly easy to set up and very roomy. It fits my gear, myself and my cot. This tent held up to 40 mph outflow boundaries, heavy rain and even light snow. I was a bit skeptical at first, due to the thin fabric and light poles, but the thinness added flexibility so it withstood the winds better than stiffer, heavier tents. My only negative comment is that you have to be careful about the loops on top of the tent as they sometimes come off the hooks and I have to rehook them. I was so pleased with this model that I immediately ordered the exact same tent to replace my old one. Great little tent!!
review.name: Used this tent for 4 years

review.reviewBody:
Easy to set up, even on first attempt didn't take more than a few minutes (alone) - it's intuitive, nothing to overthink about (like matching colours, trying to guess the side or whatever). The pole hooks for inner tent cords are an amazing innovation - I did treat them carefully after reading some negative reviews, but they don't look like snapping anytime soon. Very roomy inside, thanks to slightly pre-bent poles. It's a proper hotel for 2 and child/dog/gear, or a cozy place for 3. All in all - that's probably the best tent I've ever had at a fraction of the weight (1.8kg full set!!!). 
And the only thing it's missing (considering the price point) is a footprint, which is not that easy to find even to buy separately online.
review.name: Epic adventures await with this tent!

review.reviewBody:
Yes its light weight but it fails in a few departments
I bought this tent to replace my Nothface stormbreaker for sheep hunting, it's lighter and saves room in your backpack but as I found out it has very little integral strength to it, when the wind picked up at night the tent was  flattened to our faces, the poles were chattering  like it was about to break apart.
The fly seemed fairly water proof but the amount of condensation that formed inside during a rain was ridiculous, It basically rain inside as well. 
The tie downs from the fly to the base tent are just very thin pieces of para cord , not your usual tent pole clips or holes, when the wind picked up it would pop these off.
It does not come with a base, you will need it unless your pitching this tent on a grassy field of some sort, the tent material is vey thin.
If you want a fair weather, summer camping tent that you can use at a music festival then this is for you.
Pretty disappointed in this tent as usually Mountain Hardware makes pretty decent gear.
review.name: Fair weather tent only

review.reviewBody: High quality, lightweight and very easy to assemble.
review.name: Amazing tent!

review.reviewBody: This is the first backpacking tent I've owned in 30 years. I've only used it once so far, but both my wife and I were very happy with the tent. It was quick and easy to setup and it was comfortably big for the two of us and some of our stuff.
review.name: Very happy with this tent

review.reviewBody:
The Mountain Hardware Aspect 3 Tent exceeded all my expectations during my recent 10-day backpacking trip in Colorado. This tent proved to be an exceptional companion in the rugged wilderness, providing reliable protection and comfort throughout my journey.

One of the standout features of the Aspect 3 is its durability. Despite encountering harsh weather conditions, including heavy rain and strong winds, the tent remained rock-solid and impervious to the elements. Its robust construction and high-quality materials gave me peace of mind, knowing that I was sheltered from the unpredictable mountain weather.

Setting up the Aspect 3 was a breeze, thanks to its intuitive design and color-coded poles. Even after a long day of hiking, I could effortlessly assemble the tent in a matter of minutes. The freestanding structure allowed me to choose the ideal campsite without being limited by the terrain, providing flexibility and convenience.

Inside, the Aspect 3 offered a spacious and comfortable living area for three people. The tent's well-designed floor plan maximized interior space, ensuring ample room for gear storage and movement. The two doors and vestibules were a fantastic addition, allowing easy access and providing extra storage for our backpacks and muddy boots.

Ventilation was superb in the Aspect 3. The tent featured strategically placed mesh panels and vents, which effectively circulated air and minimized condensation. Even on warmer nights, I enjoyed a cool and refreshing sleep without feeling stuffy or claustrophobic.

Furthermore, the tent's lightweight design was a blessing during our backpacking adventure. It packed down compactly, fitting seamlessly into my backpack without adding unnecessary weight. Its durability didn't compromise its portability, making it a perfect choice for hikers who prioritize both strength and convenience.

Overall, the Mountain Hardware Aspect 3 Tent proved itself to be a top-notch shelter for my extended backpacking trip in Colorado. Its outstanding durability, easy setup, spacious interior, excellent ventilation, and lightweight design make it a reliable and versatile choice for outdoor enthusiasts. I highly recommend this tent to anyone seeking a reliable and comfortable shelter for their wilderness adventures.
review.name: exactly what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: I have had this tent for over a year and so far it has held up well. I had to set it up at night once with high winds and rain and stayed dry despite the terrible weather. The mesh actually helped because it kept the tent from being blown away during set up. (It did require 2 people to attach the fly and I did have a towel to dry the tent inside after set up). Attached is an image the next morning, I undid the vestibule due me beginning to pack up.  I have also tested it in the backyard during a blizzard and besides occasionally tapping snow off through the night it did make it through. I would not recommend it (it is a three season tent)but it is good to know that in a pinch or a change in weather the tent will hold up. The fly despite being very thin has held up to everything I have thrown at it. I have been careful with it to keep it from being punctured. On a clear night the mesh is great for falling asleep under the stars. As a previous reviewer stated some of the hooks do become undone if the weather is bad but never enough to compromise the integrity of the tent. (At a maximum 2 on the top out of 5). Overall this is amazing tent that is light, yet more durable than similar tents on the market. And yes it will fit three people comfortably with 20” wide pads (gear had to stay in the vestibule). With the silicon what’re proofing being just the cherry on top. Look to use it for many more years to come!
review.name: Light and durable tent

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this tent. Easy set up, lightweight, nice and big for 2 people and a big dog, plus our packs. Second night on a backpacking trip the rain hit for 12 hours, the tent fly started seeping water in from the top after just an hour or 2, the poles condensed water and dripped so much water onto the mesh that eventually it started raining water on all of our gear. The water seeped down the mesh walls and into the tent where the mesh ended, causing puddles to form and getting our gear wet.  It was not a great experience, we returned it the day we got back from the trip.
review.name: Not rainproof

review.reviewBody: I had a choice between this model and another almost similar one but a buck cheaper. I took this because the composition of the outer fabric was somehow special. I regret it(( Firstly, the fabric is the same as another jacket that claims to have a different coating. Secondly, the sleeve cut is very strange!! As a partner, I don’t even understand who it was made for. Obviously not for a person. The shoulder is huge, like XL, and the armhole is XS . I bought size S. I really don’t recommend this jacket to anyone. Because even if you wear it with a sweater in which the sleeves are cut like a lantern, then you won’t fit in the jacket in the armhole. Why sew something like that?? I think I’ll make a return. And buy the one with peach color and human sleeves.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had never heard of the Ben's brand before trying Ben's 30% Deet.  I must say, I'm impressed!  I did not receive any bug bites while wearing it.  It works much better than some of the more known brands, and you don't have to smell it!  I really like that it claims to stay on the surface instead of being absorbed into your skin.  I highly recommend giving Ben's a try.
review.name: Works wonderfully

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently got this about a month ago and I'm so glad that I did. The months have been unseasonably warm for this time of year, so my family has been spending more time in our yard. We tend to get a lot of mosquitoes and other creepy crawlies so I like to be prepared. 
This spray works wonders! Way better than another brand that I was using. My son seems to get bitten by everything out there. Since I started using this bug spray I haven't heard any complaints about being wicked itchy. 
The 1st time we used it, I wasn't even aware of the mosquitoes. Usually I'm slapping the heck outta myself or shooing them away. No fun at all. This time it was all fun because I wasn't worrying or shooing. 
I also like it because it doesn't stink. Most bug repellents have this odor to them that isn't to good smelling. Another plus is that it's a spray on. Makes it so much easier to cover more skin quickly. It's better than a lotion type because they can tend to feel sticky. Sticky means other thing's sticking to you as well. I'm a fan of the spray type. I will definitely be using again next spring and summer season's. 

*I recieved this product in exchange for my honest opinion and review *
review.name: Works Great!!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the design. You can't lose a bottle like this in the tent or fallen down in the grass, and the twist close cap made me feel better when packing it.
We haven't gotten a chance to use it in a really infested area, but we came home from camping with only a bite here or there from light mosquito presence that could have shown up before we put on the spray for the evening. Wish there was a DEET alternative, but when the little snots like you, you do what you need to do. Seems effective at keeping away the mosquitos.
review.name: Can't lose it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I told all of my fellow hiking buddy's about this tick and insect repellent. I am used to using the "big name" brand's of insect repellent which have a terrible and STRONG odor. With Ben's, I was super amazed at how it didn't smell like the repellents I was used to. To make it better, I did not receive ANY bites while hiking. Every time I go out to the woods, mountains or forests, I make sure to bring Ben's tick and insect repellent. It is the ONLY repellent I will use now. I highly recommend. It is super easy to use. Just spray it on and your good to go.
review.name: I'll never go back!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been perfect for hunting to keep the ticks off me and the kids. It's easy to spray comes Tina  durable bottle to throw in the backpack and works great while using it we do not get bothered by ticks or mosquitoes definently my new go to bug repellent
review.name: Works awesome!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ben 30 works amazing. It has a twist top sprayer for convenience and easy application. It is water base, and does not have an awful smell. This works great on the whole family. We are protected from mosquitoes, ticks, and other bitting bugs. We are able to enjoy the outdoors with no worries. Ben's 30 works so we can enjoy the outdoors worry free.
review.name: Works Amazingly!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product while I’m out in the yard! Kept the mosquitoes away
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What’s nice is that we’re still having to utilize this in late October. While out this weekend playing yard games we utilized Ben’s bug repellent and I actually decreased the amount of bug bites I typically get during dusk. I was really happy with how it worked but it was still a little “greasy”. Overall it did its job and I was happy with the product.
review.name: Keeps the bugs away

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This spray is amazing. I can put it on and it last for hour and I dont get bitten once while out. Usually once I step out of my house I have 6 bits within 5 mins so this is perfect. I like that it sprays out in a mist not a straight  burst. I will definitely by this and take it on putting and camping trups
review.name: Bugs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Aerosol spray that kept all Texas Gulf Coast Mosquitoes away when we were outside in our yard. No skin irritation. Lightweight to carry in backpack or purse and locks by twisting the cap to prevent accidental spraying. Sprays well and scent was faint DEET smell which didn't bother me. Product was rated one of the top Tick & Insect repellents on Consumer Reports and that in itself should tell you what a great product it is!
review.name: Great Product!

name: 30 Eco Spray

review.reviewBody:
I go on birdwatching trips, and on a bird-watching Safari, we were advised to be sure the hat we wore
wouldn't obstruct the view of others in the vehicle, so I chose this hat. It was perfect for the trip, and it turned
out to provide outstanding protection from the sun in general.  As a bonus, it was a bug deterrent!  I've worn
the hat so often that it is starting to wear out, so I've just ordered another one.
review.name: Great protection from the sun and from insects

review.reviewBody: Good for golf.  Need better colors!    The colors of the hat are all boring.   White no longer offered?   Please offer cheaper one without the “cape”.
review.name: Good for Golf except for Colors.

review.reviewBody: My husband loves this hat! He wears it for hiking and gardening.
review.name: Great coverage and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I have three of these hats. I keep one in the car and one in my backpack so I always have it on hand. I am a redhead and these do the best job of protecting my neck, scalp, and face of any hat I have owned. I also love the folding brim so it can go in a pocket. It stays on well in windy conditions if you snap it under your chin. I wish it came in more colors. Fun ones. I would love orange or teal or fuchsia.
review.name: Like the folding brim, excellent protection

review.reviewBody: This hat has been great for walking and driving around town since the sun is so hot in Southern Arizona. However, after only three months the back stitches came out so the neck cape no longer stays on, which defeats the whole purpose of this hat for me. I can sew it back together, but it's disappointing that the quality doesn't last up to its promise.
review.name: Nice hat but doesn't last

review.reviewBody:
Extremely effective and comfortable, even under a bicycle helmet. It is bulky so take that into account. If I was doing a multi-day hike or outdoor festival I would definitely pack this a long.

It's a little snug if you've got a fat head.
review.name: Pretty OK

review.reviewBody: Have worn all over the Indo-Pacific islands. Excellent sun block, and also super-convenient - can fold and fit in your packet. Simple quick-tightening when the wind picks up. Stays on even in speeding boats. And fits my large head! Highly recommended for adventure travel in the sun.
review.name: Super-versatile folding cap for hours in the sun

review.reviewBody: This is a nice hat, It is a bit large compared to my other other Sunday Afternoons hats.
review.name: Nice hat, runs a bit large

review.reviewBody:
I've purchased the Sun Guide in 3 different colors for hubby in the L/XL size (also one for my dad) and one color for myself in the S/M size.  I LOVE the foldable brim.  With the cap pulled low and the cape buttoned up, it gives amazing sun protection.  The cape is also long enough to completely cover your neck.
I think it also looks amazing worn without the cape too.  Just waiting for another S/M to go on sale so I can get a second color!  Also love the adjustable sizing strap.  Since it clips on and off, it's very handy for clipping to my purse strap when not in use.
review.name: I've purchased 5 Sun Guides...keep them coming!

review.reviewBody:
Good cap the best i had but the snap fell off just after couple uses 
It’s the second hat it happens to me with 
Very disappointing cause I can’t rely on it when im outside for few days
review.name: Snap fell of after few uses and I’ve been gentle

name: Sun Guide Cap
Sun Guide Cap

review.reviewBody:
These gloves are great and very technical. I was caught in heavy rain for 45 minutes, and they kept me dry and warm. GoreTex does its job pretty well. The gloves are warm, but for extremely cold temperatures (below 5°F), I would recommend wearing a first layer gloves underneath.
Regarding the size, BUY A LARGER SIZE THAN YOU ARE USED TO (e.g. I am L, so bought XL).
review.name: Very technical gloves. Buy a larger size

review.reviewBody: I would have love to give these gloves a chance, but the are built for long skinny fingers, not the sausages I have for fingers.  The build had the Rab quality, but they also were much stiffer than I anticipated.
review.name: For Slim Hands

review.reviewBody: Quiet the best Gloves i ve ever had. Use it for skitouring, ice and cold weathers
review.name: Perfect for all kinds of alpine activities

review.reviewBody:
Superb glove for Scottish winter climbing. It is always hard to find a great set of gloves as Scotland is always so wet! 
These gloves are warm when climbing in all conditions, from -15 to 0. 
They allow all gear to be handled easily due to the precise fingers and pre curved grip. 
When combined with a large set of mitts at belays any moisture seems to dry out and fingers crossed you'll avoid hot aches. Without the use of a mitt I found moisture build up (probably from sweat) meant when you set off from the belay hot aches were definitely experienced. 
Superb glove would recommend
review.name: Super gloves

review.reviewBody: Great service superb quality gloves will recommend
review.name: Great service superb quality gloves

review.reviewBody: Warm, light, pliable and waterproof. Perfect for mountain biking in freezing British weather.
review.name: Warm, light, pliable and waterproof.

name: Fulcrum GTX Glove

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter and I both have a Bote paddle board and my 9 year old wanted his own! It is the perfect size for him and he can’t wait to try it out! The quality of these boards are like no other, last year we had a scary accident with our travel trailer that flipped and the paddle boards flew out the under part and my daughters was run over by a truck, the bag was shredded the board unaffected at all! I couldn’t believe it! We have used it 10 times since

hasVariant.name: T-100L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch T-100L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I haven’t put this pack through full blown backcountry packing just yet, but what little I have done with this pack has left me satisfied that it is well worth the money, will last a long time, and will keep up with my demands.
review.name: Big ol’ pack

review.reviewBody:
Don’t consider any other pack.  Period.
I worked as a backpack guide for about 12 years all over the U.S., and went through multiple large volume packs, of different “top” brands, and they ALL hurt and eventually broke.  Zippers, clips, and I even had a shoulder strap rip off once.  It wasn’t until I ordered  Mystery Ranch’s largest pack, that I realized my pain and frustration was unnecessary.
The harness system felt like it was custom made for me.  The hip belt didn’t pinch or bite.  The load never felt like it was a child squirming.  It immediately felt like I had been lied to my whole life, And I had finally been told the truth.  The sleeping bag system at the bottom is world changing. The accessibility and additional strength was worlds better than the crappy zippers other companies used.  The split lid is so convenient, and the top turning into a day pack is great when you are base camping, and want to day hike.  The long tube Pockets are essential for rain gear other items you might need quickly, or in a pinch.
I 100% believe That if I would’ve started with this pack, I Would’ve saved years of wear and tear on my body.  Eventually, I got married, had kids, and settled down a bit. I held onto the pack for a few years, as I loved it so much. Eventually, I couldn’t stand seeing it unused in my closet, so I sold it to a former coworker that was still guiding. 
As a side, bonus, these packs are like Toyota trucks, they don’t lose value overtime.
Because they’re bombproof.
review.name: Back-saving Mack truck!!

review.reviewBody: Solid backpack, well constructed, heavy duty Construction and well thought out design and placement of straps to hold needed items. I would have liked this backpack to come in different colors in the future, maybe a Forrest green or any earthy colors.
review.name: Solid backpack, well constructed, heavy duty

review.reviewBody: I've only used it for a weekend snow camp so far but, so far, it's a quality product.  It's COMFORTABLE!  I can't believe how well this feels on your back.  The zippers are solid even in sub-freezing temps.  The pull tabs opposite of the zippers on the lid are a really nice touch.  They really make for easy open and closing the zippers.  The only reason for the 4 star instead of 5 is I think one of the long pockets on the front should be further divided into two pockets giving 3 pockets in front.  Overall, If you're a gear hauling pack mule like me, this pack is great.
review.name: It's a comfy haul

review.reviewBody:
I have used this pack for weekend backpacking trips and it has been fantastic.  Trips are typically 20+ miles over 2.5 days on challenging trails.  Typical full load, including water, is 35lbs for me.  I am 6'1", 195lbs have an athletic build.  I was able to get this pack to fit very comfortably given the built in adjustability.  

Pros:  Durable.  Comfortable to carry.  I like that you have the option to create the separate compartment at the bottom for putting things you need easy access to like extra layers of clothes.  The long exterior pockets on the back are great for storing things like a puffy jacket, and the top pockets are perfect for snacks and all the small misc. items you don't want buried inside the pack (first aid, multi-tool, chapstick, etc).  I have used the pack with a 3L Camelback as well as with 2x 1L Smart bottles in the side pockets.  Both work equally well.  There is a mesh pocket on the inside for the bladder and a small bungie clip on the should strap to secure the drinking hose.  The pack is definitely big, but has been perfect for winter trips where I am bringing my heavy/large sleeping bag, and extra layers of clothes.  There are several external straps to tie down things like trekking poles or a foldable sleeping pad.  

Cons:  It's heavy (6.5 lbs), but I would not say it is overly heavy for it's size.  I will probably get a smaller/lighter pack for summer backpacking, because this thing will be overkill.  I messed around with the "day pack" configuration of the top pockets, and will never use that feature.  It is way too time consuming to reconfigure and is not comfortable at all.  The compartment for the Camleback bladder is a pain to get to and makes refilling difficult unless the bladder is completely removed from the pack.  A couple of very minor things:  Wish it had the small pockets on the hip belt and more elastic rings on the straps to manage the excess length when straps are cinched tight.
review.name: Excellent Pack for 4 Season Backpacking

review.reviewBody: Bought this a month ago, but have not used it yet. Look forward to the tent-trek in the Northwestern Wind River Mtns next summer to put the T-100 to the test. As a whole the backpack is enormous and made of high-quality material. It has tremendous features: the lengthy strap to buckle down the entire load inside the main bag; 2 hood pockets, sizable 'bullet' pockets, roomy H2O pockets made of pack material. On the other hand, it contains bells and whistles it needn't have, which w/o them would help reduce weight overall: 1] the sleeping bag divider w/ fastex buckles inside the main bag is completely unnec.; 2] the 2 flaps of pack that clip into a fastex buckle, sitting around and outside the bottom zipper of the main bag seem unnec. Also, there are 2 things missing: a] small straps on both shoulder straps to hold the sipping straw from a reservoir in place; b] a key clip in one of the hood pockets.
review.name: Great features, but more than needed

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for 8-12 day expeditions into the mountains, and it does well to hold all my gear in conveniently accessible ways. My *only gripe would be how short they made the straps for attaching sleeping pads (since I carry 2 and they barely fit) as well as compression straps (I use them to attach my tent fly and other various things to the sides)
It is still a rockstar pack and would highly recommend
review.name: FANTASTIC Pack with Short Attachment Straps

review.reviewBody: After one season using this pack I am more than happy with the product. Reasonably comfortable, even with heavy loads. Plenty of room. Good features. Seems very duarble. One thing I would change is the length of the straps that attaches the lid to the pack. If they were a bit longer it could be packed higher.
review.name: Quality product

review.reviewBody: This pack is really big and is erverything I was hoping for. The frame is sturdy and allows me to have a wide range of motion. I am going to be backpacking in the Grand Canyon and will post an update after I return. My two areas of improvement I would suggest is that I could have ordered one in a different color than Black, and a lack of a pocket on the hip belt for storage of chapstick etc...
review.name: Big and sturdy

review.reviewBody: I work for a Wilderness Therapy company and spend half of my year on the trail. I have warrantied quite a few other packs over the years but have never had to go through the trouble with Mystery Ranch. I have used a 65L pack the last few summers and was so happy with the performance I picked up a 100L for winter and a 35L for use outside of work. Perhaps most importantly they come in all black.
review.name: Straightforward and Dependable.

name: T-100L Backpack
T-100L Backpack

The FR-C Pro Lyte Winter Jacket is great at blocking out the cold and wind and my new go-to winter jacket.  The rear pockets are easily accessible and functional.  The cut, fit, and overall quality are great.  This is a piece I will have for many seasons to come.  I went with the orange to stand out a little more and to be seen on the road easier. Get the matching Sienna Orange gloves to complete the kit.

review.reviewBody:
I climb indoors 3-4 times a week (boulder, top, and lead).  I climb V3-V4 and 5.10-5.11.  These are fantastic shoes.  I can smear, slab, edge, and anything else with these shoes.  They haven't held me back at all in my climbing.  I've had 2 pairs and resoled them twice and I'm about to buy my 3rd pair.  They do run small (meaning I size up to get them to fit my feet right).  

I do have a pair of TC Pros for granite and crack climbing outdoors, but I've climbed outdoors plenty with the Ras as well.  I don't recommend them for crack climbing though.  Too soft and the velcro gets caught on the crack edges.
review.name: Favorite climbing shoe

review.reviewBody:
This is a great all around shoe.  Luckily I read trusty reviews and figured out that these run a bit small, so I went up a half size to 10 (for Information purposes, I wear 9.5 in the Iati's).

Fits great and is a very comfortable all around shoe, built for steep routes but also to accompany you on your outside adventures on tricky slab.  Honestly they might be more preferred to me over the Iati's, but the Iati's have a better heel.  Still deciding on this one.

I also have very weird wide feet, so much so that my girlfriend takes pictures during our climbing session and sends them to me with the caption "Excuse me, do you know the way to modor".   Point being, if my hobbit feet can fit into these shoes comfortably, they will fit for you.
review.name: Great shoe, fits small

name: RA Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Took the time to measure as recommended and ordered accordingly.  By it is too much of a chore to squeeze my hand past the opening of the glove. Definitely need to go up 1 size larger than recommended on the size chart. As another reviewer stated, the gloves are bulkier than expected. Would probably work great for skiing, but not hiking.

review.reviewBody: I thought these would be a little less bulky, but they're gonna be super warm.  Also a tad on the small size...I got a large but probably could use an XL.  And I don't think I have particularly big hands.
