review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Expect a tight fitting glove. Very durable though!
review.name: Tight fitting but durable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a similar 686 over-cuff glove in XL and it’s too big for my hand - I have large hands so I feel this series of glove runs slightly larger than expected. Size down if you are unsure. As for the look, the orange is slightly less bright than shown in the photos. But the quality is there. Well made, lightweight and easy to take on and off.
review.name: Slightly larger than expected - great quality/lightweight.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and super warm. Pretty pumped on this glove for the price.
review.name: Love the orange.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] High quality gore-tex for the waterproof, and just the right size for finger mobility without sacrificing heat insulation. The inner lining is super soft too -- these are ideal for any kind of snow work.
review.name: Warmest Gloves I've Ever Worn

review.reviewBody: These are great gloves for people whos hands are always cold. Took them out on a -5 degree day, and my hands were sweating.
review.name: Amazing warmth

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great gloves, warmer than expected. Work really good for shoveling snow
review.name: Bitchin

review.reviewBody: My husband wore these for our first trip out to the mountain after Christmas. He said that they were warm and he really liked them, but then after about an hour, he noticed that the seam between the fingers on one glove had ripped and you can see the white inner insulation. Unfortunately, I will have to return these.
review.name: Warm, but not durable

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and super comfortable. Tons of insulation for cold days. Definitely worth the money.
review.name: Great gloves!

review.reviewBody: The ATV jacket's fit, style, and features significantly surpass any other Gore-Tex jacket I've owned. I primarily use this shell for resort riding, but it is plenty packable for backcountry missions on the splitty.

review.reviewBody: Love love LOVE this jacket, but did have to go back to my regular size of XL vs. XXL to accommodate broad shoulders and monkey arms. I'm 6'2" and 225 and was worried about the XL (which I normally wear) pulling behind back or coming up short in sleeves. I should have stayed with XL, and 686 made exchange a breeze. The material is nice and quiet (not crinkly or swishswishswish) and the zippers are BOMBER. Love all the features they packed into this jacket and it is definitely a "quiver of one" when it comes to your waterproof jacket collection!

I look forward to having this in my outdoor arsenal for years to come.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This soap is so good. I take it hiking, climbing, etc. It's so compact and easy to use. The only part I found a little tricky was separating the papers. I don't have much nail so it's a little tricky. But that will not stop me from purchasing more. It's fantastic. I gave some to family members to try and they already purchased some.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Tried this product on a recent backpack trip. Compact, lightweight, and the soap powerfull but gentle (I bought the soap for hands formula) It cleaned my hands and rinsed easily and will have multipurpose uses in future. Note: You Must use a DRY finger to remove the sheets before use as they dissolve Instantly. Will purchase again
review.name: Great Idea in a Small Package

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Even shared with another who was trying to get soap from an empty dispenser in Athens. Works well, but one hinge on case broke with first opening making it a bit hard to close well now
review.name: Better than expected

review.reviewBody: These were initially seen as a solution for sink washing on the camino, but one drop of water on the package essentially ruined the next 3-5 sheets. No way to avoid it in reality
review.name: Not a viable option

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am not a fan. If your hands are the lest it wet the whole batch gets messed up.
review.name: What a mess!

review.reviewBody: Bought it... excited to try it out... was out on a hike... found a 4' x 6' x 3' hole on the downstream side of this large rock in the middle of a beautiful little river so I could get a nice bath... pulled out a soap leave, closed it, and set the packet on that large rock... wet my hand, lathered up, and it worked well... I came up from my dunk, went back to the rock, and the river gods claimed their toll, and the soap sleeve somehow slid into the river... my catlike reflexes snatched the thing as it hit the water... but alas, a few drops entered the sleeve and I opened the lid to see the remaining 49 leaves bonding together into a hotel sized solidified bar of soap. A Homer moment for sure; but how much more to make this container airtight, I'd pay another nickel for it.
review.name: How much more to have an airtight container?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Haven't used yet but it is perfect for traveling. Doesn't take up much space.
review.name: Great for travel.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My personal favorite for a low waste option when staying clean. if only the wilderness wash strips were in stock!
review.name: Dry soap is the best soap

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Big fan of this stuff. Packs so small and light, but with a splash of water and a quick rub it’s like I’ve pumped soap all over my hands. Super helpful if you wear contacts while backpacking to sanitize your hands before getting in your eyes.

Definitely a new essential in my pack!
review.name: Hands fully lathered in soap

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product and Ultra Light which is what I needed.
review.name: Great product and Ultra Light

name: Trek & Travel Pocket Soaps

review.reviewBody:
I've worn Bell helmets for decades. I like almost everything about this helmet. My requirements in a helmet are excellent fit, excellent ventilation, a visor, ease of mounting a helmet light, and good protection, of course. With a Bell helmet, the last is a "given." This helmet has all the rest, and thanks to the excellent padding design is very comfortable.

The serious flaw is the strap, which is much thinner than I'd like, and the binders below the ears easily slip up and especially down. In fact, as received, I could not keep them properly adjusted. Inspection revealed the straps were not properly threaded through them. Whether this is an assembly defect from the factory, or whether they were mis-threaded afterwards, they slid easily. Even properly threaded, they can creep down. I thought of replacing them with the clamps that came with my old Bell helmet, but the strap on this helmet is too thin.

FYI: from the bottom of the strap binders, the straps should go under, over, under, then through the top, split, bar.
review.name: Only one serious flaw

name: Falcon XRV Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like this post but there are two problems. If you need a seatpost that sits under 7" from the collar, look elsewhere.  I'm 6'1", and on a Surly Midnight Special with a horizontal top tube, I can't reach my pedals.  That show-stopper aside, I weigh exactly 200 pounds and, at the max 300psi, the shock-absorber sags in a way it isn't supposed to. It's not supposed to sag at all.

The action with the PNW lever is grungy and not at all comfortable.

So I guess I will try it on a different bike with a sloped top-tube, lose some weight, and get a different vendor's lever.
review.name: not for short people or Clydes

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this because 1. I HATE stopping to adjust my seat post right before a decent or climb. 2. I have lower back issues so the suspension really softens the blows from hard impact due to having a Hard Tail. I love it and am going to buy another one for my wife.
review.name: This works perfect!

name: Coast Suspension Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody: Fit very weel, many pockects, fantastic (as usual) G-1000 material. Warmer than expected especially considering that it is not a goose down jacket
review.name: More than expected

review.reviewBody: Overall I like this jacket. Warm enough for NYC winters and looks good. My main gripe is that the zipper in the inner pocket rips up wool sweaters, which is crazy for a winter jacket. All of my sweaters are ripped or piling just on the left side now. On a side note, I really have come to dislike the large logo crest on the sleeve and wish there was an ability to remove it.
review.name: Nice jacket overall, but ruins wool sweaters

review.reviewBody: The Greenland no 1 is absolutely perfect for cold Minnesota winter days. We just had -15f windchill temps with blustery icy winds and nothing penetrated the g1000 outer layer and the down insulation ensured comfort while walking 3 miles around a city lake. The jacket is not puffy like my old Greenland down that I can’t even wear unless it’s -10f or colder. The Greenland no 1 is perfect, not too puffy and clunky and if needed just put on a good base layer and it’s perfect even in -15f. Very impressed by this jacket, pbbly my all time favorite winter coat. Better than Canada goose, arc teryx, Patagonia and others I have used. This one is the best! Thanks Fjällräven!
review.name: Best winter coat in Minnesota

review.reviewBody: I think this Jacket is way overpriced. I live in Minnesota, so I need a good winter jacket. I bought this one because is pretty and light but the down feature makes me think It will be warm enough. Perfect! Prety, light, and warm. Unfortunately the jacket is not for winter, maybe fall or spring. Also after one year of wearing it, the sleeves, around the wrist area are becoming so worn out that now there are holes on it. I don't work with the jacket or used it outdoors camping, so it is just a weak material or poor design. It is like a beautiful girlfriend that is giving you troubles all the time.
review.name: Pretty but bad performance.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely awesome winter jacket! Perfect for my needs when out owling in cold temps. I have many winter coats but this is my absolute favorite. The g1000 is so much better than technical gore tex type fabrics. Quiet and comfortable, slim fitting and still roomy. Good pocket for phone, gloves etc. I would say it’s perfect for my needs. Thanks Fjallraven!!! And, I do have the Greenland down as well for super cold temps. That one is a Real puffer and bulky so only for extreme conditions.
review.name: Awesome winter coat for Minnesota winters

review.reviewBody: Simply the most rugged and most comfortable outdoor pants I have ever owned (Keb trousers) and I have owned nearly all brands. LOVE these pants, I now have 5 pairs..
review.name: Rugged comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I bought this around 2 months ago in the UK. Largely disappointed with it due to lack of warmth, odd styling and down coming through the outer layer. 
If you’re thinking about a warm coat for winter this will not fit the bill. Nor is it waterproof. I live in the UK where it’s fine and mild - I feel cold wearing this jacket all the time. The neck is very open and heat just escapes. 
Giving it 2 stars as the construction is very good quality. Beyond that this jacket is kind of pointless and very expensive.
review.name: Poor warmth, odd styling, way overpriced

review.reviewBody: I've been a fan of the Fjallraven Greenland No. 1 Down Jacket for years, and it's truly one of the best-looking jackets I’ve ever owned. I get compliments on it all the time, and with two different colors in my wardrobe, it's become a staple piece for me. The craftsmanship is next-level, with an outer layer that’s not only durable but also tear-proof. This means there’s no frustrating down poking out and causing wear, which has been a problem for me with other down jackets in the past. Even after four years, one of my jackets still looks brand new, holding up perfectly through different seasons and conditions. It’s a solid investment that’s stylish, functional, and built to last—absolutely worth every penny! Hopefully one day I get to fly to Greenland with this jacket!
review.name: Best Jacket Ever!

review.reviewBody: I love the Greenland jacket. Its design is simple but stylish, tough and durable. A great casual jacket to be worn with a wool sweater.
review.name: Greenland Jacket is five stars

review.reviewBody: great every day jacket that will last forever .  It’s not a loose fit so I’m my personal opinion it’s very good if you are only wearing something light under it.  I prefer a looser fit in clothing but this can be an exception cause its very confortable , breathes well and its warm.   I have 2 one L and bought an XL (gained some weight ) not the jacket fault . For reference I’m 5,11 around 190 p.
review.name: Built for life

name: Greenland No. 1 Down Jacket - Men's
